climbs.name: Weirdos on the Rig
climbs.fa: T. Hobbs, R. Ziegler, M. Dipane. 4/2018. TD

content.description:
Long moves early on lead to a bouldery, somewhat height dependent move at the 3rd bolt. Try to shake out and bust one more boulder problem at the 4th bolt. Easier climbing leads to a fun corner. A steep exit up and left from the corner leads to a slab and anchor at 35m.

Curious to get feedback on the suggested rating on this one.

(The extension is 6 bolts, also 12a (maybe b) and is called "Even Weirder." 40m)
content.location: Located on the left side of Weird Corner area, left of the large chossy corner. Stays in the shade until about 2:00 during the winter.

content.description: Fun face & arete, don't go too far left halfway up or you'll find some loose blocks. You can toprope the chossy dihedral to the right at 5.7/8, but watch out for black widows.
content.protection: 6 bolts, or you can lead it on a couple sketchy microcams in pockets (how we did the FA).
content.location: Obvious bolted line below big corner.

content.description: Just left of Hey Bubba, start with tricky face and arete, then through a chossy section. Traverse left and tackle the nice headwall with cool technical moves to the Hey Bubba anchor.

To the right of Hey Bubba Watch This is an easier face climb. Clip the first bolt of Hey Bubba then head up and left past more bolts to an anchor. The crux is a traverse right following the weakness, the next bolt seems too far left.
content.location: Shares the first bolt of "Hey Bubba, Watch This!" then follows a bolt line up and right.

content.description: Nice little 6 bolt route.  Immediately left of "Don't make me laugh".  They share an anchor.

climbs.name: Hey Bubba, Watch This!
climbs.fa: Greg Barnes, Karin Wuhrmann, Barry Hutten, May 2002.

content.description: Fun overhung face to a big ledge, then exposed thin face. Can link the pitches past the big ledge, but it's a great belay. The two bolts that are close together on the first pitch are because the next section above the second bolt is hollow rock (although it doesn't look like it).
content.protection: Bolts. Rap 40' to Weird Al then to ground, or you can just get off from the top with a 70m.
content.location: Right of Weird Al; starts up a little dihedral.

climbs.name: French Kiss
climbs.fa: Robert Zambetti, Michael Obadia, Mike Lachtanski

content.description: To the right of Wierd Al is a chossy looking corner. It actually climbs better than it looks, though there is a bit of choss. Stemming, jamming, and face holds past 6 bolts to chains. A little sporty.
content.location: To the right of Wierd Al

content.description: This is the extension to Weirdos on the Rig.  Climb Weirdos to the first anchor (a few long slings and easy backcleaning help), then continue up techy off-vertical face climbing slightly right of the Weirdos anchor. The crux (12a) comes at the last 2 bolts and follows an overhanging finger crack in a block. Classic heart breaker finish! An 80m rope is just enough to lower to the ground, knot your ends though, it's close.
content.location: Left side of Weird Corner. Stays shaded until 1-2pm.

content.description: Fun technical climbing, old-school rating, definitely not a bolt ladder. With the ongoing grade creep, this will be probably be 5.10a R soon.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Supposedly you can get optional pro, but I couldn't find any.
content.location: Around right of Weird Al, on the far left of the Staying Power Towers in old editions of Marty's guide.

content.description: The big corner. Hollow rock, but we trundled the really loose stuff. Fun long hand crack finish on second pitch. The second pitch ends just before the top below a chossy, overhung offwidth.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 1.5" cam, and a couple 2" cams. 100' from top anchor to top of Weird Al.
